I was complaining about learning nothing from shinsa (NY 2006)other 
than a=
 falling off temperline in the tip is (maybe) a fatal flaw. 
Since I am def=
initly a 'newbee' and I study, study, study, I found 
something called YAKI=
OTOSHI. I also studyied the JUYO BIJUTSU HIN and 
TOKUBETSU JUYO blades tha=
t have this wonderful feature. Yakiotoshi is 
of no concern, infact an attr=
ibute to old, Koto swords. 

I am happier to find this out myself from stud=
ying than to have 
nothing told to me after a shinsa. What they could have =
said, "This is 
a Koto blade possibly made by Sukesada but we won't paper i=
t due to 
the temperline running off in the tip". Even without paper, thats=
 
money well spent.
